alert.note: Alert for Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Lower Columbia; Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 27 at 1:32AM PST until February 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, except 5 to 10 inches above 1500 feet. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...One band of moderate to heavy snow is expected to move through this morning, making travel very difficult for this morning`s commute. After a brief break around midday today, occasional bands of snow are expected this afternoon through Tuesday morning. Snow levels will vary between sea level and 1000 feet due to the showery nature of the precipitation.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
